intro: Acinodendron bracteolatum, commonly known as the African milkwood, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in savannas and rocky areas. The tree has historical uses in traditional medicine and is also valued for its timber and as a source of shade.
